justification: The authors state that the screening questionnaire "included ... Beck Depression Inventory (BDI: to index depression symptoms)" indicating BDI was the instrument used to measure depression symptoms.
The paper notes the inclusion of the "Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI: to index clinical anxious symptoms)" demonstrating that BAI served as the measure for clinical anxiety symptoms.
The screening battery comprised the "State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI: to index state- and trait-anxiety)", specifying that the STAI state subscale measured participants' current (state) anxiety.
The same sentence indicates the STAI was used "to index state- and trait-anxiety", so the trait subscale operationalised trait anxiety.

measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) – Positive subscale
justification: The authors list the "Positive and Negative affect schedule (PANAS: to index currently positive and negative affect)", showing that the PANAS positive items measured positive affect.

measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) – Negative subscale
justification: The same PANAS reference notes its use to "index ... negative affect", identifying the PANAS negative items as the measure of negative affect.
Under SCR results, the article reports "SCRs were significantly higher in the threat condition compared to the safe condition", confirming SCRs were used as a physiological index of anxiety/arousal.
